result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony D Robertson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tony D Robertson appeared by video.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Tony D Robertson.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Received and Filed. MATC Firearm Safety Course Certificate

Defendant Tony D Robertson in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his  right to have an in person hearing and agreed to proceed by Electronic Means.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Elements of the Offense/  WIS JI - Criminal

Defendant Tony D Robertson in court with attorney Haley Wentz for Jason A Findling.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for Status Conference. 
Discussion held off the record. Defendant has been approved for the Early Intervention Program DPA and  request a hearing date.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Parties advised this hearing will be held in person, Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tony D Robertson in court with attorney Haley Wentz for  Jason A Findling.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Status Conference. State emailed defense counsel discovery link on 4/14/2022  and a potential dpa offer pending tad results.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tony D Robertson in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defendant advises the court that he was recently laid off from his job. Court orders defendant to contact the public defenders office to see if he qualifies for public defender representation by the next court date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.

This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Tony D Robertson
Current: 5061 N 38th St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 03-10-2022)
Prior: 4244 North Teutonia Avenue Apt 5, Milwaukee, WI 53209
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tony D Robertson in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/10/22 @ 2p
